p:
In this study, we interviewed 42 traditional sellers of qīng-căo-chá tea (
Table 1 ). According to the data presented in
Table 2 , traditional sellers of qīng-căo-chá tea were mainly males (80.95%). This might be related to this society's traditional preference for males over females and the fact that the formulas are only passed on to males. Moreover, because boiling tea is a labor-intensive job, males are thought to have more physical strength to engage in this occupation.
